intro: Siphocampylus albiguttur, commonly known as the white-spotted siphocampylus, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbel-shaped inflorescences. It is a herbaceous plant with slender, hairy stems and finely divided, pinnate leaves that often have a silvery or grayish underside. The flowers are small, white or pale yellow, and arranged in clusters that give the plant a delicate appearance. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands or stream banks. Due to its unique appearance and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
